H0.text: What was the name given to a decorative cloth put over a chair as protection from grease in the hair or hair oil. Hairshield

H1.text: What was the name given to a decorative cloth put over a chair as protection from grease in the hair or hair oil. Greaseguard

H2.text: What was the name given to a decorative cloth put over a chair as protection from grease in the hair or hair oil. Pomadeprotector

H3.text: What was the name given to a decorative cloth put over a chair as protection from grease in the hair or hair oil. Antimacassar

A4.text: An antimacassar is a small cloth placed over the backs or arms of chairs, or the head or cushions of a sofa, to prevent soiling of the permanent fabric underneath.

A5.text: Around 1850, these started to be known as antimacassars.
